snippet: A dispute between Representatives Bill Pascrell and Steve Rothman over a newly drawn district has complicated the party’s hopes of winning back the 25 seats it needs to recapture the majority in the House.
abstract: Dispute between Reps Bill Pascrell and Steve Rothman, both New Jersey Democrats, over a newly drawn Congressional district has complicated the party’s hopes of winning back the 25 seats it needs to recapture the majority in the House; when Rothman's home in Fair Lawn was dropped into a reconfigured Fifth District that tends to favor Republicans, he decided to move to Pascrell's new, heavily Democratic district, and run against him.

byline.original: By KATE ZERNIKE and RAYMOND HERNANDEZ

lead_paragraph: A dispute between Representatives Bill Pascrell and Steve Rothman over a newly drawn district has complicated the party’s hopes of winning back the 25 seats it needs to recapture the majority in the House.

headline.seo: Bill Pascrell and Steve Rothman Battle Over N.J. District
headline.main: Incumbent Democrats in Fight for a Redrawn House District
headline.print_headline: Incumbent Democrats in Fight for a Redrawn House District
